content: What is expected response when an input parameter in an operation is a type batch/transaction bundle. Since operation endpoint is a black box - there is no expectation of FHIR RESTful CRUD on the endpoint so the guidance here would not apply. It seems to be that only a Bundle of type collection would be appropriate as an input parameter?
You could pass a transaction to an operation that did something like "evaluate if this transaction would succeed" or even that processed the transaction in some "special" way.

this guidance on response suggests must do a RESTful create for each entry:...

"For a batch, or a successful transaction, the response the server SHALL return a Bundle with type set to batch-response or transaction-response that contains one entry for each entry in the request, in the same order, with the outcome of processing the entry"

and for each element: " Bundle.entry.response.status 1..1
Definition
The status code returned by processing this entry. The status SHALL start with a 3 digit HTTP code (e.g. 404) and may contain the standard HTTP description associated with the status code."

Does a 201 on an entry imply a RESTful create?

e.g. a respsonse like this:

{
    "resourceType": "Bundle",
    "id": "42941562-0747-498d-8c02-e37f312f3e99",
    "type": "transaction-response",
    "link": [
        {
            "relation": "self",
            "url": "http://hapi.fhir.org/baseR4"
        }
    ],
    "entry": [
        {
            "response": {
                "status": "201 Created",
                "location": "Patient/87904/_history/1",
                "etag": "1",
                "lastModified": "2019-07-10T22:56:19.306+00:00"
            }
        },
        {
            "response": {
                "status": "201 Created",
                "location": "Encounter/87905/_history/1",
                "etag": "1",
                "lastModified": "2019-07-10T22:56:19.306+00:00"
            }
        },
        {
            "response": {
                "status": "201 Created",
                "location": "Condition/87906/_history/1",
                "etag": "1",
                "lastModified": "2019-07-10T22:56:19.306+00:00"
            }
        },
        {
            "response": {
                "status": "201 Created",
                "location": "Communication/87907/_history/1",
                "etag": "1",
                "lastModified": "2019-07-10T22:56:19.306+00:00"
            }
        }
    ]
}
..or would you strip out location, etag, and lastmod and maybe add a hint or info in outcome. ?
and that would not imply anything beyond "successfully processed "
